description.narrative: Funding under this initiative provides support to the Food and Agriculture Organisation (FAO) to assist the Department of Planning within the Ministry of Agriculture and Forestry (MAF) in collaboration with the National Statistics Centre to undertake the second National Agriculture Census and the Risk Vulnerable Survey. The collection of data will inform: impact of climate change/variability; fluctuating food prices and declining availability; natural resource base (land, water and forest); level of food in security and determinant of food insecurity; vulnerability natural hazards; and linkages between food insecurity and malnutrition. The survey will sample around 650 households per agro-ecological zones, totalling 4,000 households in 100-150 different villages spread out in the country with results from the survey will enable targeting aid programme effectively. The total value of this initiative is $360,000 over 2 years, starting 2009-10.
